website_summaries.verdict: This gig bag features a rugged, waterproof design, and we really love the loop on the back as an out-of-the-way storage option.
pros: Features a large front pocket, in addition to a neck pocket
In addition to straps and a handle, this option also offers a back hanger loop, so it can be hung on the wall
cons: Has a bad odor right out of the box, which will fade in time
Some buyers felt the padding was too light to be effective

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for acoustic guitar, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the item description, this is really designed for electric guitars, not acoustic. That said, my auditorium (000) acoustic fits--snugly, but it fits. (My Seagull S6 barely fits; I'd suggest something bigger for a standard dreadnought.) Very little padding/cushioning. I would recommend something sturdier for travel, but this will be fine for at-home storage. I like the fairly plain design (I don't like providing free advertising for bag brands). I wish the zipper opened farther (i.e., around the bottom of the body). Materials/construction seem quite decent for this price. If you mainly need a dust-cover for a medium-body guitar, this will do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit but works. Great for acoustic and electric guitars.
customer_reviews.text: The acoustic was a little snug, maybe it will stretch a small amount. But it did fit ok without too much effort. It's a slim bag and a put my electric in it and it was fine, did not bounce around loosely in there. The pockets are great for picks, sheet music, notes. Bag feels sturdy, zipper and handles are strong. You can ScotchGuard waterproof spray it if you think you might get caught in rain. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Dean C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit to my Garryson acoustic guitar
customer_reviews.text: The bag finishing is ok, looks realy good and my guitar survived a light rain. After a few weeks using it I could rise it a full 5 stars, with the following improovement suggestions: - I miss some soft stuffing in the bag that would make me feel more confident in leaving my guitar inside it without worrying light bumps. - The straps should have another sewing solution. The metal part close to bag body keeps turning. - The straps are too narrow and get frequently twisted. - The accesory pouch is a perfect fit to my cables and tuner, unfortunatelly it is too small to fit my home printed songbook (A4 size)
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome guitar bag for my guitar
customer_reviews.text: Awesome guitar bag for my guitar. It is convenient for you to put on your back or carry with silicon handle by the side. Inside is well padded with thick sponge around the thickness of 5 quarters and high quality lining. For me, the only purpose for this was to keep my guitar protected for an upcoming move. Exceeds my expectations. As good as any that cost much more.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Good guitar bag. Really comfortable to carry!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight yet sturdy. Really big front pocket for your music things. From xlr cords to music binder, it should fit in the front pocket. I wish the pocket has some sort of organizers inside. Nonetheless, the pocket works. Extra pocket on top!
customer_reviews.author: John Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: Mildew and Stains
customer_reviews.text: When i received the bag, it smelled strongly of mildew and had staining on the bottom of the bag. Quality control is clearly an issue. Very unimpressed. Item returned and will not be re-purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Offers very little protection of guitar. Zipper doesn't open the bag enough to get the guitar in without trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Great value?
customer_reviews.text: For twenty bucks, I took a chance. I figured I'd be getting something cheesy but what the heck? All I needed was something to keep dust and moisture off my axe...not to be dragging it around on gigs. So I was really surprised to discover that this is a pretty good case. Decent padding. A couple pockets. Sturdy enough zipper. If I had a quibble it would be that the little pocket on the front is too narrow and deep for picks. And they should have put a small pouch on the inside for a Snark tuner. But other than that, it's a super bargain. Highly recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Leon Davis

customer_reviews.title: Wish it fit a full size folder
customer_reviews.text: Overall a really good value if you just want something to keep your guitar from getting scratched. A lot of pockets in various sizes. It’s very light so it doesn’t add much to carry. My only gripe is that it won’t fit a folder. I bought another one in the same price range with less pockets and it didn’t fit a folder either. It was the Cayuga. Even though it didn’t fit what I really wanted it to I kept it because it’s still pretty useful. Just don’t expect it to able to fit music books or even an iPad Pro because it won’t.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Decent Case for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Hi guys! I am writing a review for this case! First of all, this is not your top of the line case. If you are in a band or are playing regularly, invest in real hard case that is durable. This is a lightweight case that has some padding to protect from minor damages and small bumps and and hits. It is also water resistant, but not water proof. With that being said, for the price, this case is excellent and it will protect your guitar while you transport it and prevent it from getting scratches. I also enjoy the spacious pockets for my sheet music, capos, picks and extra strings and tuners.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Identity

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement Case
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case to replace a worn and battered hard case that was close to 50 years old. The old case provided good protection for my guitar, but it was bulky and difficult to pack into a loaded car. This new case is light, yet provides good protection and padding for the instrument. It's much easier to carry and I appreciate the carrying straps that allow use as a backpack. The fit is a bit snug for a full-sized guitar, and I do like the large storage pocket for music. On the other hand, I wish there was at least one more smaller, compartmentalized storage pocket for smaller gear (picks, capos, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Dan R.

customer_reviews.title: This item has over 1,000 good reviews & for good reason. 👌
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for an inexpensive but sturdy case for a dreadnought guitar. This was only $20 bucks and had over a thousand good reviews, so I bought it & I see why! It’s very well built, it’s extended length fit my Epiphone AJ220vs (41 inch dreadnought) and protects it very well. Excellent build quality and few like if the guitar were to fall over or be dropped in this case - it would not be damaged at all. Would buy again, and again
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: Complete GARBAGE! The quality of this guitar case is trash. When I received this case, I placed my guitar into it. I then picked it up by one of the shoulder straps and the metal connector broke off. Update: Shortly after submitting my review, the company contacted me and offered to resolve the issue I had with a replacement. Apparently this company cares about its customers and that has earned a higher rating with my review. I look forward to receiving the replacement and I do hope it was just a fluke issue. Update: I recieved the replacement item today. It was covered in white crud. Terrible quality control.
customer_reviews.author: James Mongeon

customer_reviews.title: Smells like death
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the bag was terrible! Spend an extra $10 I get something that won't give you cancer and doesn't smell like burnt hair.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan James

customer_reviews.title: Thanks it's a nice guitar backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Came with some free items thanks. It's great fits perfectly for my guitar to go inside better than how I had it inside its box it was just taking to much space now it's a lil less with the bag/backpack for the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: xZombie19

customer_reviews.title: Best deal !
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great case to me ! Fits a Ibanez Gio just fine. I use it mostly just to keep the dust off or to transport to a friends place to jam. Relatively inexpensive too.
customer_reviews.author: studpuppie

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great soft case for the money. I little tight for a full size dreadnought but it works well for my concert body guitar. I read complaints from those wanting to get more protection. This isn't designed to work like a hard case, but I store three of my guitars in these.
customer_reviews.author: ACB

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag for the money, and holds the extras
customer_reviews.text: I use this case for an American made Fender F-35 dreadnought. Primarily for short hikes, and other outdoor activities brought about by the global pandemic and the need for making music to kill the chaos for a moment. The neck pocket is big enough for a capo, tuner, and picks. I usually keep a 1/2" binder, tab note book, and a Marine Band harmonica, with room to spare. The only need for improvement I saw: I had a regular day backpack on, and carrying for a mile, the side handle dug into my hand a bit. This was easily solved with a padded luggage handle cover.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Henry

customer_reviews.title: Do not be alarmed! It fits
customer_reviews.text: This case may seem small when you first get it to fit a big acoustic guitar in it (especially mine, which probably was within half an inch of the maximum supported length) but it just needs to stretch out and accommodate the guitar. At first I was super worried it wouldn't fit since I had to almost squish it in, but after that first time it held the shape and I have no problems fitting my guitar in there anymore! Recommend (but may attention to dimensions!)
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great Gig Bag
customer_reviews.text: My son actually got this to transport his lightsabers and Nerf guns back and forth to his friends house. Lots of room for that. being a musician myself, it looks like for guitar, it appears it would do a great job! however I've not checked it out for a guitar. Much better and a better price than many in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: dave stabnau

customer_reviews.title: Does it all
customer_reviews.text: I have several hard guitar cases, and I like them, but I always wish there was room for other things I like to have with my guitar. This one does it, and protects the instrument quit securely. Most importantly, it has a pouch on the outside that lets me carry, my two favorite songbooks, Rise Up Singing and Rise Again along with space for even more. So glad my wife found this and bought it for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Zinn

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Very nice item! have a smaller guitar that I picked up at a thrift store. I just wanted something simple and inexpensive to cover and protect it. It fits a little looser than I would like, but that's ok. Great bargain for $19.98! Sturdy straps, pockets and a loop to hang on a hook. Quality nylon material and nicely padded. Totally exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: ReindeerGames

customer_reviews.title: Just like advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's just what it says, nothing special but made well, a few more bucks next time I'll get a lined one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Very fragile!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product of any category I've ever purchased. It doesn't even deserve a star. It was all ripped apart by the end of one transatlantic trip. That's less than a day of use. Better off getting a speeding ticket. I guess you get what you pay for. $26!!
customer_reviews.author: Dinks

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's guitar. What you see is what you get. The material is great quality and the entire case feels sturdy, zippers included.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel Ornelas

customer_reviews.title: Really great quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality. My daughter was so happy with it. Two different carrying options!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Heister

customer_reviews.title: Fit my guitar well
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this guitar bag. Keeps mine protected without adding a lot of weight to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Lillie

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I just needed an affordable case for an acoustic I take around to band practice. This fits my dreadnought Yamaha FGX800C and has a pocket for cables/a pedal/picks/tabs. It looks like it would be pretty water tight, should it drizzle/rain on you when trying to transport the guitar from your car to inside or something. Rating based on it being a $20 case.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Collins

customer_reviews.title: Convenient guitar case.
customer_reviews.text: Soft guitar bag with convenient straps; a traditional handle, a handle on the flat side, and back straps to carry it like a backpack. Good pocket storage too.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is good, but the product
customer_reviews.text: The customer service saw my review and send me a new one and that is why I am giving three stars. Because, the product wasn’t good but the customer service is good. The quality of the product is not great I bought it for my son few months ago and he use it like tree times and I realized that The straps are breaking and the front bag as well. I hope the new one it’s better.
customer_reviews.author: Lou-an

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, lightweight guitar case!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Daisy Rock Acoustic guitar. There are vertical straps on the back so I can carry it like a back pack, or there is horizontal strap that is perfect for hanging it up on the wall. There is a large pocket on the bottom front and a smaller, narrow one above it on the neck to store accessories. Great quality, lightweight, and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Choate

customer_reviews.title: This case won’t cover a full size guitar
customer_reviews.text: Don’t Buy this case if you have a full sized guitar. It won’ fit! Amazon charged me $5.99 to ship it back, almost half the price of the item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Firefly 338
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for 2 Firefly 338s I bought on Amazon and they work great for the Firefly. These are supposed to be for an acoustic but I thought I would gamble to see if they would work for the Firefly. The fit is loose but they work. Not a bad bang for the buck. Will they stand the test of time, not sure. But for now, they are getting the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Aces&8s

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but wish it was a little more padded
customer_reviews.text: Bought this gig bag as a cheap temporary bag. It's quite roomy, and for that reason, I wish it was a bit more padded. Still, it seems fairly durable, and the many storage compartments are nice. If you're in need of a bag but don't want to pony up for a more expensive case, then this should work nicely. Just be sure to pay attention to the measurements given.
customer_reviews.author: Requia

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the money, but this bag will provide zero protection for your guitar. The zipper is also very iffy. If you have to have a gig bag and have very limited funds, this will work, but it is probably a good idea to look for a better product. One cool feature is that it has backpack straps for easy wearing. Again, not a terrible product especially for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fits my full size acoustic dreadnought perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality materials, very good padding. Really big pocket for books or accessories. Handles and straps are substantial and well made. Definitely recommend this for anyone that wants to transport their acoustic guitar safely, without having to lug a hard case around.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Should help protect the guitar
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my brother in law. When it first arrived, it didn't look like it'd fit the guitar, but it did. It also has a nice pocket to hold sheet music and the simple chord book we got him. It's a soft case and can fold up really well. Removed a star because this thing stunk really badly. Tried to air it out a bit before wrapping, but when he opened it Christmas morning, it made the whole living room smell.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Gig Bag- fair to middlin.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it fit my guitar A full size accustic guitar. The bottom plastic piece for a protection is nice. The material is fair the padding meets the minimal requirements..It has plebty of pockets. You get what you pay for. If your looking for something that has some padding then this works. Oh smells funny at first then I sprayed some air freshener took care of the odor. Would I buy it again for a kick around gig bag. "Probably would"
customer_reviews.author: bodiji

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap bag.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Fender Sororan SCE perfectly! The padding is adequate, will get you from gig to gig (kind of the point of a gig bag.) Obviously doesn’t provide enough protection to tour with. Get a good hard shell case for that. Suits my occasional open mic night needs very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Oh yes, you should get this!
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's an absoultely awesome product! Nothing from it feels cheap or that it's going to break with use, it all feels reliable. Lightweight? Yes. Sturdy? Oh yes. Value for money? Oh baby YES I still don't know any use for the little pocket on the top though. But the big pocket on the bottom is great! It doesn't intrude inside the bag like other bags I've used when trying to get the guitar inside. So if you are at a budget like me just get it!
customer_reviews.author: Danny F

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a good case. If you are looking for something with a little protection and to keep dust off I would recommend this case. It would probably not offer a lot of protection if you dropped the guitar. The material is ok but it does not feel super high quality. My full size acoustic fits inside the case.
customer_reviews.author: csp24

customer_reviews.title: A fine option for an inexpensive gig bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed an option to a large cardboard case for a Yamaha FG 700 to take on vacation and get togethers. This fits the bill perfectly. Well made and a large storage pocket, this will do fine. Price is great for what you get. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Blakeney

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Guitar Case
customer_reviews.text: I just received this guitar case and I am really impressed with the quality of this case. Years ago, I had a hard case for my guitar. This case is well padded and I really like the pockets, too. It is a little big for my small guitar but I am happy with the weight of the case and the protection. I would recommend this case to others.
customer_reviews.author: Betti

customer_reviews.title: Value and fit
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my yamaha fg800. Fits well, the zipper is close to the guitar but if you carefully do it, like taking care of any item you value, it will not scratch the guitar. I will buy another one if i have another guitar. It has 2 pockets. One on the body and one on the neck end part. Back strap are sturdy and front handle is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Fits my guitar snug and comfortably, seems to provide enough padding as long as I don’t drop it out a third story window. Which I will not be doing. Love the straps, can carry it on my back. Or grab it by a handle and carry it like a briefcase. Plenty of pockets for extra gear.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod

customer_reviews.title: Great padding and value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to keep my entry-level acoustic guitar protected during a cross-country move. The moving company did not pack the encased guitar in a box or add any additional padding, so I was curious if the guitar was going to survive the move crammed into a moving truck with 12000lbs of other items. It made the trip without a scratch, which is a testament to the quality of the bag and the care of our movers.
customer_reviews.author: Jwm

customer_reviews.title: if you have a guitar and your not really traveling
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case. It is soft ( came folded up and taped). However, it is not a case you would use to toss your guitar in the trunk or on a plane in. Luckily I'm not traveling with my guitar yet, so this case is just to make sure dust and dirt dont collect too much on it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginner or if you need something cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Good buy if you are not carrying it around all the time. I wanted it to cover my guitar at home so it works for my need. A little tight fitting. The don’t pull the zipper hard it doesn't feel like it will last if you do that. And the inside material is that thin felt (like the stuff under chairs) that will disintegrate over time. I really like it and it fits my needs for now.
customer_reviews.author: ASE

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I buy this at the end of March and it is already broken (June). It looks great and felt sturdy, but it is not.
customer_reviews.author: KarlaIOM

customer_reviews.title: More of a cover than a case..
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly the case arrived in a package about the size of a small cereal box.., Anyway after carefully unfolding it I discovered that it actually WAS an extremely thin guitar case. It does fit an acoustic guitar but I certainly wouldn't travel anywhere with it that I expected my guitar to be in one piece when it got there. I would consider this more of a dust cover than a case. For the price I gave it 3 stars because it's ok and does cover the guitar for home storage purposes...but if you want to travel anywhere with your guitar then buy a regular case.
customer_reviews.author: harry stout

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: My Ibanez acoustic guitar fits inside it perfectly. There are handles all over the place for easy carrying, including two straps for carrying it like a backpack. Padding is better than my old bag. It has a nylon zipper that opens smoothly. It was delivered a few days after ordering with standard shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dlhopolsky

customer_reviews.title: Be advised -- photos are deceptive!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag has considerably less form that the photos would lead one to believe -- in fact, it has no form whatsoever! I'm sure it's fine as protection from the rain, but little else. If one of my cats jumped on it, I doubt that the guitar would survive.
customer_reviews.author: wvk

customer_reviews.title: Just Enough To Protect-Barely!
customer_reviews.text: This bag should be good enough to store in the house, but would be reluctant to carry instrument to gig in this bag. Padding is quite thin, one drop and your instrument may suffer damage! And this is the upgraded bag! Still, you get what you pay for. Pocket sizes are good for a notepad or two, straps seem a bit smallish.
customer_reviews.author: Oldskool

customer_reviews.title: easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for the protection of my fender electric guitar. I'm very happy with my purchased. my guitar is now well protected. this is my second purchase.I own two electric guitar,and one acoustic guitar.
customer_reviews.author: bulldog2927

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase as a case for one of 2 guitars we own. Noticed the other guitar is slightly wider and does not fit in this carry-bag. So just be aware that it will not work for all guitars.
customer_reviews.author: LTC

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, bag is larger than announced!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought it, returned and got a new one with exactly same problem - size was bigger than announced. I have a 41 inch guitar and there was A LOT of room left inside. It is upsetting that returning and ordering a replacement nothing was different, same product! Amazon should also review the lot that they have that is completely different than announced.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel de Oliveira Chiarion

customer_reviews.title: A Good Bag
customer_reviews.text: I just received the bag and overall am very happy with it overall. I needed a light bag just to put my guitar in for going camping or for road trips In the back of the car. The construction is good, the zippers are sound and it has a couple of pockets for extra stuff: picks, capo, tuner, etc. The padding is adequate to protect the guitar from dings and bumps in transit. It is a good bag for those purposes and you can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: JRH

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the money
customer_reviews.text: Descent fabric gig bag. Padding seems reasonable. Plenty of handles, straps and loops. No flaws in the one I received. My Ibaneze acoustic fits nicely. I paid more for the cheesy vinyl one that shattered on a cold night years ago. I am quite pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Romer Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this for his new electric guitar. He loves it! It fits the guitar well and provides plenty of protection. It also has a great pocket up front for him to carry his music and his note book! He's really happy!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for an old acoustic.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a case just to keep the dust off of an old 1940's Harmony Archtone until I get around to restoring it. This worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: A Cushion for My Guitar
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I received the Cahaya 41 inch Guitar bag. It is easy to place the guitar in the bag and to remove it. While it is cushioned by the padding, I feel that the guitar is secure and easy to transport. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Fellner

customer_reviews.title: Guitar Bag : A low price for a great bag! A GOOD BUY.
customer_reviews.text: This guitar bag is nice, protective, and lightweight. It fits a standard guitar easily and the fit and finish is great. The low price makes this bag such a great value.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price and very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: As far as soft cases go, this is perhaps one of the nicer ones I've owned. Very sturdy, and does a great job of keeping my guitar from shifting around. Great padding, and much thicker than I originally expected. Great construction and versatile design. I would highly recommend this case!
customer_reviews.author: Seanzilla

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for light use.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great temporary bag for light use. I wouldn't use it for daily carry. The fabric is light, no padding whatsoever. Definitely, nice if guitar is a hobby, but not for a gig. I did not care that the bag does not open fully to leave the top off and you have to slide the guitar in.
customer_reviews.author: HOMS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice guitar bag for the price. It has generous padding and a couple of zipped pockets, which is nice. I read the reviews about it fitting a little tight, so we bought the 41" for our 39" guitar, and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong for $16.00
customer_reviews.text: New acoustic guitar that stays at home. No dust and no scratches with this case. If you travel....what else do you need?
customer_reviews.author: Steve Collister

customer_reviews.title: Measure first
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson’s vintage guitar . The guitar was too large for it but he had another that fit it. I should of looked at the measurements a To make sure it would of fit.
customer_reviews.author: Maude Grey

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: My old case got ruined in storage, so i bought this as a cheap replacement. It's not the prettiest thing to look at as it has very little character, but it does a perfectly good job holding my guitar. I will say that it offers little to no protection, so I wouldn't put anything too expensive in there.
customer_reviews.author: Troy A.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite case yet
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap and everything that I wanted in a guitar case. It had a pocket on the front that conveniently fit standard sized papers and folders and my guitar fit perfectly inside.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Santos

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Lightweight Soft Case
customer_reviews.text: The case is just right for my needs. Light in weight, zippers work well. Overall, exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: MCM

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to carry!
customer_reviews.text: If I had one criticism It would be that it could have a bit more padding to protect the instrument. I bought it right before I had to take my guitar with me on a trip to Florida and it was able to survive being checked luggage. A very good product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Alan F. Bessen

customer_reviews.title: wonderful customer service
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Martin X series perfectly with the pocket fitting a binder for my music. I'd happily used this bag 1 time a week for 4 months when the stitching on the shoulder strap began pull at the point where the strap attached to the bag. I emailed customer service and the replaced that bag promptly. For the money, you can't beat the quality and service.
customer_reviews.author: TX mom

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for my guitar!
customer_reviews.text: This provides sufficient protection for my guitar when storing and transporting. It has plenty of handles around the case, so it's easy to carry and the handles are conveniently placed. The fabric on the inside seems of slightly lower quality, but its held up great so far. I also like the relatively large pocket on the front. I can easily carry my books, tuner, pencils, etc. However, the smaller pocket on the top isn't as good. It's not very wide and is kinda deep, so when I dropped my pick down there, it was hard to fit my hand in the pocket to reach it. So don't put loose picks in that pocket. I just put my capo in there.
customer_reviews.author: Marysol

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and carry on
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for my daughter’s guitar. Very sturdy, gives a lot of protection for the guitar including a vinyl finish on the outside protecting it from rain or wetness damage. Easy carry on strap makes it extra good for transporting the guitar around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Barely having padding. Torn off in less than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pham

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I've only carried my guitar in this case about 25 times and every seem is already ripped. I understand it's a cheap bag, but I don't understand how this happened to my bag yet there are so many positive reviews. I just want people to see that even highly rated items on Amazon can be problematic. If you care about your guitar, buy a better bag...I'm too scared to use my bag anymore because with these rips it seems the guitar could fall at anytime and get busted on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 gig bags. One for a guitar 3.5 inches thick and the other guitar is 4.5 inches thick. Both fit great. These bags exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Modreaux

customer_reviews.title: Very awesome
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the cost. It's well made. Nice padding, lots of handles, straps and pockets for cords, picks strings whatever. I was expecting a basic bag but I was surprised.
customer_reviews.author: thrashreno

customer_reviews.title: Delivered more than promised
customer_reviews.text: Facing a roadtrip to a family event lasting over a week and not wanting to take my acoustical guitar, I selected this guitar case for protection of my full size jazz guitar. The case is an excellent value, arrived quickly and is of excellent construction. Seldom does a sight unseen purchase so significantly exceed expectations but that is exactly what happened here. Fits full size guitars and provides excellent protection. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BBsell

customer_reviews.title: First guitar gig bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bag for my very first guitar! The guitar fits perfectly and the bag is in great condition. The bag also came with a few extra picks. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: thekingsdaughter

customer_reviews.title: Keeps everything together
customer_reviews.text: This case gets the job done. My son needed an easy way to carry his guitar, music, etc to practices and this case allows him to do that. He still has to be careful as it doesn’t protect like a hard shell case does, but definitely worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Padding is pretty thin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar bag based on it being an Editor's Choice. In retrospect I should have paid more attention to the description, because .3 inches of padding is pretty minimal. On the plus side, it's snug but my full-size acoustic guitar fits perfectly. In hindsight I'd recommend springing for a few extra bucks and get a bag with more padding.
customer_reviews.author: D. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and price
customer_reviews.text: My Alvarez AD60CE arrived today while this case arrived a few days earlier. A perfect fit and enough pockets to suit my use.
customer_reviews.author: Golden State Warriors Fan

customer_reviews.title: Well made, fits great!!
customer_reviews.text: I had borrowed a gig bag from a friend for my acoustic guitar and it fit a little sloppy. This guitar bag fits great, not loose or sloppy at all and looks to be quite well made making it a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk E.

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Best you can expect from a soft case.
customer_reviews.text: Fabric is as tough as you’d see on any quality piece of sporty luggage or camp gear, without it being hard shell. Thick sturdy padding and heavy duty zipper. Pocket looks big enough for music folders iPads. Chrome book or small laptop. Handles are durable and shoulder straps plenty big. Snug for my grand auditorium may be too tight for dread. Headstock of my 12 just fits. I’d prefer the zipper went all the way around the body.
customer_reviews.author: Mike  Fuller - civics teacher.

customer_reviews.title: Good guitar bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to put my acoustic guitar in while we moved. I'ts lightweight but sturdy. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Would I use this to transport my $2000.00 guitar? Probably not, but to cart around my assortment of well-worn bangers to local gigs it's just right. And you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Slidewell

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: The description said fits normal acoustic guitar, definitely didn't. Company wouldn't do anything to refund or replace
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and no padding
customer_reviews.text: To small for our guitar check your measurements carefully this is small. Also not any padding just light material
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My guitar fits perfectly! Material is sturdy and material is durable! Have had it for a while and haven’t had any problems with the material falling apart or peeling.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a big baby Taylor acoustic and it fit it like a glove. The case seems to be padded nicely. Great value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mad Macs

customer_reviews.title: Good value guitar protection
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband to keep his guitar protected while driving a semi. He says that's a really good value and would recommend. The padding is good enough, the zippers are sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Esoterica

customer_reviews.title: Good for really short trips.
customer_reviews.text: I have a cheap $60 guitar that I just needed to lug around a few times. It’s a really snug fit but it does fit. It’s good for occasional use. I definitely wouldn’t trust this anywhere near an airport. Or really anywhere outside the back seat of a car or under the bed. Good for what I needed it for though.
customer_reviews.author: Casper

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved the fact that this was waterproof. I walked home in the rain and my guitar was still dry. It gets the job done and you can fit lots of stuff in the front pocket. But unfortunately, I couldn't fit a binder in it. Otherwise, a great product. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a guitar bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an inexpensive (but vintage) acoustic guitar. Only rating a 4 on "sturdiness" because this is, after all, a soft-sided gig bag. However, it appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H.

customer_reviews.title: Decent gig bag
customer_reviews.text: Firs my acoustic guitar perfectly. Great when all you need is a gig bag or a little protection for storage. Great deal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: TooMuchStuff

customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my first guitar. Im starting to learn. It's a great protector for a wonderful price!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit, but arrived smelling terrible
customer_reviews.text: This bag fits my acoustic quite snugly, but it arrived with a terrible smell. I had to air it out for a day just to use it. The bag is quite thin, and the quality of the straps and the handle are not great. Overall, this is not a good travel bag, it is only passable as a dust cover. EDIT: The smell never left. The bag is not protective and I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the money, it's alright. Beware of Prop 65 odor.
customer_reviews.text: The positives for this case is that it is a solid case to put a guitar in. More than anything else, just to have a guitar cover while in the house. It's not thick enough in my opinion to take a nice guitar outside or on the road. The negatives of the case, it has a strong smell which is quite annoying when taking it out of the case. I'm suspicious that this product might have an odor chemical in the proper 65 category. Just beware when you buy it, if you can find a better case for a little more, I would do it.
customer_reviews.author: Kale Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar case for my daughter and it fit well, a bit long but thats ok. Sturdy and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid G.

product_meta.title: CAHAYA 41 Inch Acoustic Guitar Bag 0.35 Inch Thick Padding Waterproof Dual Adjustable Shoulder Strap Guitar Case Gig Bag with Back Hanger Loop, Black
feature_bullets: 0.35 in thicker padding and larger front pocket than previous version.Really worth the price!
42.1 x 16.3 x 4.7 inch, compatible with 39/40/41 inch acoustic & classical guitars
Soft bag with waterproof oxford cloth exterior
Dual adjustable shoulder straps + three handles for convenience. This new version guitar bag with back hanger loop can be hung on the wall for decoration.
Two exterior pouches: one on front body and one on neck; can fit sheet music, documents, music books, accessories (pedals, adapters, cables, tuners, etc.)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,827 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
